CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The target poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) was obtained by Suzuki polymerization of M1 and M2 in degassed toluene / water with K 3 PO 4 as an organic base , Pd 2 ( dba ) 3 as a catalyst , and P(o-tol) 3 as the corresponding ligand at 90 °C for 3 days.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT) |
| M1 |
| M2 |
| K 3 PO 4 |
| Pd 2 (dba) 3 |
| P(o-tol) 3 |
| toluene |
| water |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT) |
| M1 |
| M2 |
| K 3 PO 4 |
| Pd 2 (dba) 3 |
| P(o-tol) 3 |

The other entities in the paragraph (toluene and water) do not refer to materials, but rather to the reaction conditions.

Paragraph: The target poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) was obtained by Suzuki polymerization of M1 and M2 in degassed toluene / water with K 3 PO 4 as an organic base , Pd 2 ( dba ) 3 as a catalyst , and P(o-tol) 3 as the corresponding ligand at 90 °C for 3 days.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value            |
|-------------------------|

The following entities were removed as they do not clearly refer to material properties:

* degassed (describes the condition of the toluene/water)
* 2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole (describes the type of polymer)
* Suzuki polymerization (describes a chemical reaction)
* M1 and M2 (refer to reactants)
* dba (abbreviation for a ligand)
* Pd (symbol for palladium)
* o-tol (abbreviation for a ligand)
* catalyst and ligand (describe the role of substances in the reaction)
